title.narrative: Key national institutions and women NGOs apply the international standards set in Istanbul Convention and CEDAW in providing services to women and girls victims of violence.

description.narrative: Serbia Programme Presence will support enabling legislative and policy environment in line with international standards on eliminating violence against women and girls, and will support available, accessible, and quality services to women and girls who experience violence to ensure better responses to violence against women and girls. Serbia PP will support the Ministry of Interior response to violence against women and the work on joint evidences in cases of violence against women and girls. Furthermore, the work under the regional programme on violence will continue through the support to women NGOs, to support the implementation of the Istanbul Convention. Serbia PP will strengthen capacities of women's civil society organizations (CSOs) so that they can lead on measures such as the empowerment of women and girls’ victims of violence, establishment of a rape crisis centre, provisions of services to women from specific groups, such as Roma women and women with disabilities.
